case_vignette: A 24-YEAR-OLD MAN COMES TO THE PHYSICIAN WITH A WOUND ON HIS FOREARM. HE SAYS THAT HE INJURED HIMSELF BY ABSENTMINDEDLY WALKING INTO A GLASS DOOR. HE DOES NOT HAVE HEALTH INSURANCE. HE HAS HAD 5 JOBS IN THE PAST 8 MONTHS. HE QUIT EACH JOB AFTER 3–4 WEEKS BECAUSE HE FOUND THE WORK BENEATH HIM. HE WAS IMPRISONED 6 YEARS AGO FOR CREDIT CARD FRAUD. HE WAS RELEASED FROM PRISON ON PAROLE A YEAR AGO. HE WAS EXPELLED FROM SCHOOL AT THE AGE OF 13 YEARS FOR STEALING SCHOOL PROPERTY AND THREATENING TO ASSAULT A TEACHER. HE HAS FATHERED 6 CHILDREN WITH 4 WOMEN. HE SAYS THAT HE DOES NOT PROVIDE CHILD SUPPORT BECAUSE HE NEEDS THE MONEY FOR HIS OWN PERSONAL EXPENSES. THE PATIENT'S VITAL SIGNS ARE WITHIN NORMAL LIMITS. EXAMINATION OF THE FOREARM SHOWS A 6 CM LONG, 0.5 CM DEEP WOUND WITH NEAT EDGES ON THE DORSAL SURFACE OF THE LEFT FOREARM. THERE ARE BRUISES ON THE LEFT SHOULDER, BACK, AND THE PROXIMAL PHALANGES OF THE RIGHT HAND. ON MENTAL STATUS EXAMINATION, THE PATIENT IS ALERT AND CALM. HIS MOOD IS DESCRIBED AS CHEERFUL. HIS THOUGHT PROCESS, THOUGHT CONTENT, AND SPEECH ARE NORMAL.
question: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS THE MOST LIKELY DIAGNOSIS?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.

I have a 6 cm long and 0.5 cm deep cut on my left forearm and some bruises on my left shoulder, back, and the fingers of my right hand.
Have you recently had any injuries or accidents?
Yes, I injured myself by absentmindedly walking into a glass door.
How long ago did this incident happen?
I'm sorry, I don't have specific information on when the incident happened.

No, I'm not experiencing any numbness, tingling, or inability to move my limbs.
Have you had any similar incidents or injuries in the past?
I don't have any information on similar past incidents or injuries.
Do you have any medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
I don't have any medical conditions and I am not taking any medications.
Final Diagnosis: Laceration
